lin: ah|Board 1|md|1SKT642H76DAQJTCK5,SQ7HJT942D642CAQ6,SA853HQ85DK98C874,SJ9HAK3D753CJT932|an|WillJO|pn|Declarer,West,Dummy,East|sv|o|nt|Click the word DECLARER near the South cards to hide the other three hands. Click NEXT when ready to start.|mb|1S|an|You are dealer, and Spades is your longest suit, so you bid 1S|nt|You are the Dealer, so you get to bid first. You have a reasonably good hand, and your longest suit is Spades, so you open the bidding with 1S. |mb|P|an|Not a great hand|mb|2S|an|Partner also likes Spades, so bids to 2S|at|Your partner also likes Spades, so raises the Spades. |mb|P|an|Not a great hand|mb|P|an|No reason to go any higher (yet!)|at|There are reasons go bid higher than just 2S, but not yet!|mb|P|pc|HJ|nt|They lead the Jack of Hearts against your 2S contract. |pc|H5|at|Your Queen probably won't win, so you might as well not play it. |pc|H3|pc|H6|pc|HT|at|They lead another Heart, |pc|HQ|at|and you can try your Queen, |pc|HA|at|which loses to the Ace.|pc|H7|pc|HK|nt|If the Defenders try leading a third Heart, |pc|S2|at|you have no Hearts, so can play any card, including a TRUMP. Any trump beats anything else. |pc|H2|pc|H8|pc|S4|nt|A good plan when you are playing in a trump suit is to lead out some Spades, |pc|S7|pc|SA|at|winning, |pc|S9|pc|S3|at|and again. |pc|SJ|pc|SK|pc|SQ|at|The opponents have run out of Spades, but you have some left. |pc|DT|nt|Now lead your other cards, |pc|D2|pc|DK|at|winning some extra tricks. |pc|D3|pc|D8|pc|D5|pc|DA|pc|D4|pc|DQ|pc|D6|pc|D9|pc|D7|pc|DJ|pc|H4|pc|C4|pc|C2|pc|S6|pc|H9|pc|S8|pc|C3|pc|C7|pc|C9|pc|CK|pc|CA|pc|CQ|pc|C8|pc|CT|pc|C5|pc|C6|pc|S5|pc|CJ|pc|ST|
